item.title: Local authorities. Simon Priscilla, Denise Corbin, antisocial behaviour department, local councillors, local mayor of Hackney, the commissioner of the metropolitan police, could you please all put your brains together and come up with a solution to stop this anti-social behavior and criminal activity taking place on the Trowbridge estate which is on the rise. Drug users junkies shiting outside leaseholders garage door 13,12 white male around 21:00pm.local authority could you please address this issue of anti-social behaviour. Drug users junkies,crackheads loitering and waiting in between Osborne Road garages and brickworth way to pick up drugs on 15/03/25 at 21:00pm. Junkies trying to break into leaseholders rented garages. local junkie was nosing around near leaseholders garage doors trying to open door. Possibly looking for somewhere to sleep for the night. Local residents feel unsafe and insecure with junkies, drug users on the increase in the area on the Trowbridge estate. Residence of getting scared to come out of a night because there is a constant flow of all different drug users loitering. Also urinating and shiting. There are families that live on this estate this is terrible behavior for residents to witness even small children. Local authorities have a duty to protect members of the public and residents.These issues need addressing ASAP.Also there is a property at 25 Trowbridge Rd, London E9 5LD which is attracting this anti-social behavior and criminal activity local criminals using the property as a drug den.The mayor of Hackney, police commissioner, management Simon Priscilla,Denise Corbin, local councillors would not like it if this was happening outside their home address would they., 1st October
item.description:
Hackney Council do not care about antisocial behavior drug users s******* outside lease hold garages. Hackney Council care about one thing they rent and that's all do not care about residents or lease holders. This is why antisocial behavior goes on.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hillman Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Masses of litter/dumped takeaways all up street, 1st October
item.description:
There is masses of litter and dumped takeaways/packaging running all up and down Deverell street. The street is in a dire state and often seems to get like this. It does not appear to be taken care of as this is a regular problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deverell Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees and bushes, 1st October
item.description:
The close is covered with overgrown trees and bushes. The road is full of leaves berries (very slippery) and twigs. Half the road is unpassable by car and getting worse. We would appreciate it very much if the bushes could be cut and the road and curb-side could be cleaned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tresco Close, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: URGENT ATTENTION NEEDED!!! Overflowing bins not cleared for weeks., 1st October
item.description:
There are overflowing bins and bags full of rubbish on the pavement and around the green area which has not been cleared for weeks and it is increasing everyday. Can the bin get cleared and removed from the road and placed it back in its allocated space. URGENT ATTENTION NEEDED.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Park Road, New Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet
